sen.j: 小出 英尚（こいで ふさなお、嘉永2年9月3日 (旧暦)（1849年10月18日）- 明治38年（1905年）9月27日）は、丹波国園部藩の第10代（最後）の藩主。
sen.e: Fusanao KOIDE (October 18, 1849 - September 27, 1905) was the tenth (the last) feudal lord of Sonobe Domain in Tanba Province.
Fusanao KOIDE (October 18, 1849 - September 27, 1905) was the tenth (the last) feudal lord of Sonobe Domain in Tanba Province.
Fusanao KOIDE (October 18, 1849 - September 27, 1905) was the tenth (the last) feudal lord of Sonobe Domain in Tanba Province.
He was the tenth of the Koide family of the Yoshichika clan.
He was the tenth head of the Koide family of the Yoshichika clan.
He was the tenth head of the Koide family of the Yoshichika clan.

sen.j: 第9代藩主・小出英教の長男。
sen.e: He was the first son of the ninth feudal lord, Fusanori KOIDE.
He was the first son of the ninth feudal lord, Fusanori KOIDE.
He was the first son of the ninth feudal lord, Fusanori KOIDE.

sen.j: 正室は坊城俊政の娘・録子。
sen.e: His lawful wife was a daughter of Toshimasa BOJO, 録子.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Toshimasa BOJO, 録子.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Toshimasa BOJO, 録子.

sen.j: 継室は浅倉七五郎の娘・菊江、庭田重胤の娘・胤子。
sen.e: His second wives were a daughter of Shichigoro ASAKURA, Kikue, and a daughter of Shigetane NIWATA, Taneko.
His second wives were a daughter of Shichigoro ASAKURA, Kikue, and a daughter of Shigetane NIWATA, Taneko.
His second wives were a daughter of Shichigoro ASAKURA, Kikue, and a daughter of Shigetane NIWATA, Taneko.

sen.j: 子は小出英延（長男）、小出英経（次男）、小出英鋪（三男）、娘（東胤禄正室）、娘（松平義為正室）、娘（大谷尊由室）、娘（黒田長敬正室）。
sen.e: His children were Fusanobu KOIDE (the first son), Fusatsune KOIDE (the second son), 小出英鋪 (the third son) and four daughters (lawful wife of Tanetoshi TO, lawful wife of Yoshitame MATSUDAIRA, lawful wife of Sonyu OTANI, and lawful wife of Nagayoshi KURODA, respectively).

His children were Fusanobu KOIDE (the first son), Fusatsune KOIDE (the second son), 小出英鋪 (the third son) and four daughters (lawful wife of Tanetoshi TO, lawful wife of Yoshitame MATSUDAIRA, lawful wife of Sonyu OTANI, and lawful wife of Nagayoshi KURODA, respectively).

His children were Fusanobu KOIDE (the first son), Fusatsune KOIDE (the second son), 小出英鋪 (the third son) and four daughters (lawful wife of Tanetoshi TO, lawful wife of Yoshitame MATSUDAIRA, lawful wife of Sonyu OTANI, and lawful wife of Nagayoshi KURODA, respectively).

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、伊勢国守。
sen.e: He served as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and director of Ise Province.
He served as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and Ise no kuni no mori (Govenor of Ise Province).
sen.cmt: Ise no kuni no mori修正
sen.e: He served as Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and Ise no kuni no mori (Govenor of Ise Province).
He was born in October 18, 1849.
He was born in October 18, 1849.
He was born on October 18, 1849.

sen.j: 安政2年（1855年）、父が死去したため、翌年の3月19日に後を継いだ。
sen.e: Due to his father's death in 1855, Fusanao succeeded him as the head of a family on March 19.1855.
Due to his father's death in 1855, Fusanao succeeded him as the head of a family on March 19.1855.
Due to his father's death in 1855, Fusanao succeeded him as the head of a family on May 5, 1855.

sen.j: 幕末の動乱期では早くから朝廷に味方して、京都の警備などを勤めた。
sen.e: In unquiet days of the end of Edo period, he took the Imperial Court side early on, and served as a security guard and other posts.
In unquiet days of the end of Edo period, he took the Imperial Court side early on, and served as a security guard and other posts.
In unquiet days of the end of Edo period, he took the Imperial Court side early on, and served as a security guard and other posts.

sen.j: この時期、万が一京が戦火に飲み込まれる事となった場合は天皇を英尚の居城園部城に避難させるという策が立てられた。
sen.e: At this time, the measures that they evacuated the Emperor to Sonobe-jo Castle where Fusanao usually resided, in case Kyoto was enveloped in a wartime fire, was adopted.
At this time, it was planned that in case Kyoto was surrounded by a wartime fire, they would evacuate the Emperor to Sonobe-jo Castle where Fusanao usually resided.
sen.cmt: 主語が長いのでシンプル化しました。
sen.e: At this time, a measure was introduced whereby the emperor would be evacuated to Sonobe-jo Castle, where Fusanao usually resided, if Kyoto were to be surrounded by fire during a war.

sen.j: 結局、京は戦火から逃れ天皇も京にとどまったが園部城は幕末という大変な時期に大改築されている。
sen.e: After all, Kyoto survived the war and the Emperor stayed in Kyoto, however, Sonobe-jo Castle was entirely rebuilt in such a rough time, the end of Edo period.
After all, Kyoto survived the war and the Emperor stayed in Kyoto, however, Sonobe-jo Castle was entirely rebuilt in such a rough time, the end of Edo period.
After all, Kyoto survived the war and the Emperor stayed in Kyoto, however, Sonobe-jo Castle was entirely rebuilt in such a rough time, the end of Edo period.

sen.j: 幕府が大政奉還した後は完全に新政府側に与し、西園寺公望が指揮する山陰道鎮撫軍に従った。
sen.e: After Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor), Fusatada completely contributed to new government side, and followed Sanindo Chinbugun (a military unit formed specially for the campaign in Sanindo) under Kinmochi SAIONJI's command.

After Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor), Fusatada completely contributed to new government side, and followed Sanindo Chinbugun (a military unit formed specially for the campaign in Sanindo) under Kinmochi SAIONJI's command.

After Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor), Fusatada completely contributed to new government side, and followed Sanindo Chinbugun (a military unit formed specially for the campaign in Sanindo) under Kinmochi SAIONJI's command.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）6月、版籍奉還により藩知事となる。
sen.e: In July 1869, he became the governor of domain due to return of lands and people to the emperor.
In July 1869, he became the governor of domain due to return of lands and people to the emperor.
In July 1869, he became the governor of domain due to return of lands and people to the emperor.

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）7月、廃藩置県により免官となる。
sen.e: In July, 1871, he was dismissed from office due to Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).
In August, 1871, he was dismissed from office due to Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).
In August, 1871, he was dismissed from office due to Haihan-chiken (abolition of feudal domains and establishment of prefectures).
Later, he became viscount.
Later, he became viscount.
Later, he became viscount.

sen.j: 明治38年（1905年）9月27日、57歳で死去した。
sen.e: On September 27, 1905, he died at the age of 57.
On September 27, 1905, he died at the age of 57.
On September 27, 1905, he died at the age of 57.
